original_solution_mapping.L1: There are 30+7+13=<<30+7+13=50>>50 pieces of bread after the first duck ate
original_solution_mapping.L2: The first duck ate half of all bread so 50*2=<<50*2=100>>100 pieces of bread were thrown in the pond

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 7078.
    Returns: the total number of pieces of bread thrown in the pond.
    """
    # L1
    pieces_left_final = 30 # 30 pieces of bread left in the water
    duck3_ate = 7 # the last duck eats 7 pieces of bread
    duck2_ate = 13 # Another duck eats only 13 pieces of the bread
    pieces_before_first_duck_ate = pieces_left_final + duck3_ate + duck2_ate

    # L2
    half_factor = 2 # One duck eats half of all the pieces of bread
    total_bread_thrown = pieces_before_first_duck_ate * half_factor

    # FA
    answer = total_bread_thrown
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: There are {pieces_left_final}+{duck3_ate}+{duck2_ate}=<<{pieces_left_final}+{duck3_ate}+{duck2_ate}={pieces_before_first_duck_ate}>>{pieces_before_first_duck_ate} pieces of bread after the first duck ate

The first duck ate half of all bread so {pieces_before_first_duck_ate}*{half_factor}=<<{pieces_before_first_duck_ate}*{half_factor}={total_bread_thrown}>>{total_bread_thrown} pieces of bread were thrown in the pond

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: There are 30+7+7=<<30+7+7=44>>44 pieces of bread after the first duck ate
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: The first duck ate half of all bread so 44*2=<<44*2=88>>88 pieces of bread were thrown in the pond

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'duck3_ate' (7) was used instead of 'duck2_ate' (13).
